timeline.bodyText: Compile this pattern in a static final CONSTANT for performance so it doesn't have to recompile this pattern on every call.
timeline.author: melloware

replies.bodyText: Based on https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7233#section-4.2, I would go for ^bytes (\d+)-(\d+)\/(\d+|\*)$
replies.author: Rapster

timeline.bodyText: Probably safe to throw an exception here as its an expected case.
timeline.author: melloware

timeline.bodyText: chunks are never submitted as a value (and that's on purpose), so this condition will never be verified
timeline.author: Rapster

replies.bodyText:
IMO the core question is do we want to to have a chunkListener? Or are we fine with the „normal“ listener which get´s fired after the last chunk.
The code you wrote last night fired the „normal“ listener after each chunk. With my modification we fire chunkListener after each chunk and the „normal“ listener is fired after the last chunk was uploaded and we have the whole file on the server.
From my side i do not think we need the chunkListener. IMO ist kind of nice2have.
replies.author: christophs78

replies.bodyText:
That's actually something have been wondering as well, do we need this chunkListener...? The only use case I have in mind is whenever you want and can calculate something over chunks (as mentionned digest for example) instead of processing the whole file. Have a look at https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/security/DigestInputStream.html to have a clearer of what I'm referring to.
Right now, that's probably something we don't really need, being said, the use case I mentionned might be solved using a custom FileUploadChunkDecoder
replies.author: Rapster

timeline.bodyText: The chunkDir is deleted right after the final file is merged, I'd rather delete the chunks in one shot after making sure the final file is merged
timeline.author: Rapster

replies.bodyText: Deleting chunkDir with (chunk-)files within throws a DirectoryNotEmptyException.
replies.author: christophs78

replies.bodyText: Ah indeed... Last night I brought a lot of modifications just like this one, I guess it was too late to see it 😅 Anyway i'll have a look at it
replies.author: Rapster
